TopicTitle: Female Kerbal Possible Concept Art (they are supposedly androgynous but bear with me)

Articles.Content:
For instance, it is generally considered true that forum participants of any game are only a small portion of those who actually play.

Hahaha can relate. I have another Filipino friend who just recently I surprisingly found out, plays KSP too, and the first thing he told me was "There IS A FORUM???"

you play good devil's advocate

It`s my favourite occupation. If they ever needed a lawyer I`d give it a go. I`ve been practicing my opening speeches. "Your honour, my client is a product of it`s creator and was no given free will. I therefore submit that they are as guilty of their crimes as a gun would be in a murder trial and so I call God to the stand..." etc.

Hahaha can relate. I have another Filipino friend who just recently I surprisingly found out, plays KSP too, and the first thing he told me was "There IS A FORUM???"

LOL then let me steer you back on topic. So I told the artist of the hair requests some of you wanted, but she just said "Yes okay" and no reply to choice and I since don't want to dictate stuff to her, I'll leave it to her to decide on what hair to adapt.

LOL then let me steer you back on topic. So I told the artist of the hair requests some of you wanted, but she just said "Yes okay" and no reply to choice and I since don't want to dictate stuff to her, I'll leave it to her to decide on what hair to adapt.

Sounds good to me. :3 I am not particularly picky anyway.

You guys reminded me of this.

CONTENT WARNING, IF YOU ARE 18 OR LESS COVER YOUR EYES AND SCROLL FAST.

Now to give my opinion, it wouldn't bother me to have female kerbals, as long as it doesn't mean pushing back resources -again- for it.

That actually looks a lot like my idea of a female kerbal. The eyes are right, like table tennis balls. The head looks like it was made from putty. Lose the dopey expression, put it into a spacesuit, cut the hair, shorten the limbs and body and it would be about right.

Currently it looks like it would be about twice the right height.

Hi girls and guys, I just thought you'd like to know that female Kerbals are something Squad want to do, but it's an end-of-development polishing thing, don't forget KSP is still being actively developed.

It'll come eventually, but like all things it takes time, there's just so many other things to do as well

hi girls and guys, i just thought you'd like to know that female kerbals are something squad want to do, but it's an end-of-development polishing thing, don't forget ksp is still being actively developed.

It'll come eventually, but like all things it takes time, there's just so many other things to do as well

yay!!!!! =^.^=

Hi girls and guys, I just thought you'd like to know that female Kerbals are something Squad want to do, but it's an end-of-development polishing thing, don't forget KSP is still being actively developed.

It'll come eventually, but like all things it takes time, there's just so many other things to do as well

Well you heard it "straight from the horse's mouth" (is this expression still being used? LOL I am sorry if it sounds awful)...they will eventually come, so it's not a bad idea after all, to like, just talk about it and "play"/have fun with ideas! Deep inside I was confident that Squad would indeed integrate this, so that was my basis for starting the thread. Thanks Sal, much appreciated!

Used to be. Born and raised in Florida. Lived there most of my life. However I moved recently out of country to be with my fiance. Probably will visit a lot still since majority of my family is still there of course :3 I am kinda glad I am out of the hot humid weather. South Florida gets really gross during the summer -.- ... Now you completely lost me I don't know how to steer back to the topic after that Oh wait, Florida...the Cape...KSC...hey! KSP has a KSC too! And this KSC will eventually have female Kerbals, as confirmed by a mod. Yeehaa! Steered back to the topic, finally! I'm a regular ASAS with a gimbal strapped to his ass

Lol, I'm no Dev, just a Mod in case you were wondering, but I remember from the Kerbalcon stream that female Kerbals were brought up, and HarvesteR said it was something they'd do towards the end of development.

Seeing as the main point of this thread has been answered now, I think it's time this was closed as it's degenerated a few times now, plus those concepts by rodion_herrera's friend are freaking me out
